analyzed: gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu ma mchis grangs ma mchis tshad ma mchis pa dag na mchis pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu ma mchis / grangs ma mchis /
translated: immeasurable, and limitless world systems of the ten directions

original: tshad ma mchis pa de dag kyang theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs shing /
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa de dag kyang theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs shing /
translated: have trained in this Great Vehicle

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bgyid lags te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bgyid lags te /
translated: and attained the state of omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po lags te /
translated: Blessed One, for that reason, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings,

original: 'di ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba'i theg pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba'i theg pa lags so //
translated: because it is the vehicle called the equality of the three times.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have been helped by the perfection of wisdom, how much they have been favored by the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis @315b kyang theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs shing /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis @315b kyang theg pa chen po 'di la bslabs shing /
translated: The tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas of the past, future, and present have trained in this Great Vehicle and

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes so //🔽brnyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes so // brnyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: have attained the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will attain it.

original: brnyes par mdzad do //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: brnyes par mdzad do // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: They are attaining it.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu dgu pa'o ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu dgu pa'o //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: This was the nineteenth chapter, “Overcoming,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu drug pa /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: bam po bcu drug pa / de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Chapter 20: The Perfection of Wisdom

original: tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said this to the Lord:🔽“Lord, it is amazing how much the bodhisattva great beings have been helped by the perfection of wisdom, how much they have been favored by the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i slad du bskul ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i slad du bskul ba mdzad pas /
translated: this elder Subhūti has been urged by the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, for the sake of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po bstan par sems lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po bstan par sems lags so //
translated: He thinks that the Great Vehicle should be taught.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal bar theg pa chen po bstan pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal bar theg pa chen po bstan pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, have I taught the Great Vehicle in a way that contradicts the perfection of wisdom?

original: gcig tu ma gyur lags sam /
analyzed: gcig tu ma gyur lags sam /
translated: Have I not made it into one thing?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / de ltar gyur pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar gyur pa med de /
translated: Subhūti, that has not happened.

original: rab 'byor / khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po ston pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, you have taught the Great Vehicle in a way that accords with the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the dharmas of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: the dharmas of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: the dharmas of a bodhisattva,

original: sangs @316a *// rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /🔽dge ba'i chos gang ci'ang rung ba de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus shing /
analyzed: sangs @316a *// rgyas kyi chos rnams sam / dge ba'i chos gang ci'ang rung ba de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus shing /
translated: the dharmas of a buddha,

original: yang dag par gzhol ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yang dag par gzhol ba'i phyir ro /
translated: or any other good dharmas, all of them are included in the perfection of wisdom and are gathered in it.🔽”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus shing yang dag par gzhol ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus shing yang dag par gzhol ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dge ba'i chos de dag gang lags /
translated: what are the good dharmas of the wings of enlightenment that are included in the perfection of wisdom and gathered in it—the dharmas of hearers, the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of bodhisattvas, and the dharmas of buddhas?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, they are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of magical emanation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path;

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu @316b dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu @316b dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the absence of forgetfulness,

original: rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / de dag ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus shing /
analyzed: rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa ste / rab 'byor / de dag ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus shing /
translated: and always remaining in equanimity.

original: yang dag par gzhol ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dge ba'i chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par gzhol ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dge ba'i chos rnams yin no //
translated: Subhūti, those are the wholesome dharmas of the wings of enlightenment that are the śrāvaka dharmas, the pratyekabuddha dharmas, the bodhisattva dharmas, and the buddha dharmas that are included in the perfection of wisdom and are completely included in it.

original: rab 'byor / de la theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: Subhuti: What is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being?

original: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / mig gang yin pa dang / gzugs gang yin pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa gang yin pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i chor  ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / mig gang yin pa dang / gzugs gang yin pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa gang yin pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i chor  ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: The Lord: The five perfections, the thirty-seven wings of enlightenment, the three doors to deliverance, the four applications of mindfulness, etc. to: the eightfold path, the three doors to deliverance, the four foundations of mindfulness, etc. to: the eightfold path, the three doors to liberation, the emptiness of the subject, etc. to: the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, the four holy truths, the four absorptions, the four formless attainments, the eight deliverances, the nine attainments of successive stations, the ten universal bases, the ten powers of a Tathagata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, the six superknowledges, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the eighteen special dharmas of a Buddha, the great friendliness, the great compassion, the great sympathetic joy, the great impartiality, the knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of all paths, the knowledge of the unique way, the cognition of the awareness of all things, the cognition of the awareness of the range of the All-knowing One, the cognition of the awareness of the range of the Tathagata, the cognition of the awareness of the range of the Arhat, the cognition of the awareness of the range of the Pratyekabuddha, the cognition of the awareness of the range of the Bodhisattva, the cognition of the awareness of the range of the Disciple, the cognition of the awareness of the range of an ordinary man.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid gang yin pa dang / chos rnams gang yin @317a *//
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid gang yin pa dang / chos rnams gang yin @317a *//
translated: and phenomena,

original: pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa gang yin pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba gang yin pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang /
analyzed: pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa gang yin pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba gang yin pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang /
translated: and the thinking-mind consciousness, and thinking-mind contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of thinking-mind contact, and the four establishments of mindfulness,🔽and the four right efforts, and the four legs of miraculous power, and the five faculties, and the five powers, and the seven aspects of awakening, and the path, and the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and the four fearlessnesses,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: and the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and the four noble truths, and the emptiness gateway to freedom, and the signlessness gateway to freedom, and the wishlessness gateway to freedom, and the eight deliverances, and the nine serial absorptions, and the ten universal bases, and the five eyes, and the six clairvoyances, and the four concentrations, and the four immeasurable states, and the four formless absorptions, and the five powers, and the five strengths, and the seven aspects of awakening, and the noble eightfold path, and the three gateways to liberation, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, and the four noble truths, and the emptiness gateway to freedom, and the signlessness gateway to freedom, and the wishlessness gateway to freedom, and the eight deliverances, and the nine serial absorptions, and the ten universal bases, and the five eyes, and the six clairvoyances, and the four concentrations, and the four immeasurable states, and the four formless absorptions, and the five powers, and the five strengths, and the seven aspects of awakening, and the noble eightfold path, and the three gateways to liberation, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, and the four noble truths, and the emptiness gateway to freedom, and the signlessness gateway to freedom, and the wishlessness gateway to freedom, and the eight deliverances, and the nine serial absorptions, and the ten universal bases, and the five eyes, and the six clairvoyances, and the four concentrations, and the four immeasurable states, and the four formless absorptions, and the five powers, and the five strengths, and the seven aspects of awakening, and the noble eightfold path, and the three gateways to liberation, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, and the four noble truths, and the emptiness gateway to freedom

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, suffering, origin of suffering,

original: 'gog pa dang / lam dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gang yin pa dang /
translated: cessation of suffering, and the path, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm, the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams gang yin pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams gang yin pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, the tathāgatas, the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata,

original: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa dang / bsam @317b gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa dang / de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa dang / bsam @317b gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The expanse of reality, suchness, the very limit of reality, the inconceivable expanse, and nirvana—all those phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined;

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: are unimpeded,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa yin pas /
translated: and have a single defining mark—that is, they are without defining mark.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, for that reason

original: khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po ston pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po ston pa yin no //
translated: you teach the Great Vehicle in accordance with the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / theg pa chen po'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / theg pa chen po'ang gzhan la /
translated: Subhūti, the Great Vehicle is not one thing,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom another.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of tolerance, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity are one thing,

original: theg pa chen po'ang gzhan /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'ang gzhan /
translated: and the Great Vehicle is another;

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang gzhan zhing /
translated: the applications of mindfulness are one thing,

original: theg pa chen po'ang gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'ang gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the Great Vehicle is another.

original: de ltar na theg pa chen po dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar na theg pa chen po dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: Thus, the Great Vehicle and those applications of mindfulness are not dual and are not divided.

original: theg pa chen po'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'ang gzhan la /
translated: the Great Vehicle is one thing,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are another.

original: de ltar na theg pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar na theg pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: Thus, the Great Vehicle and those eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are not dual and are not divided.”

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan @318a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan @318a *//
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is taught by the teaching of the Great Vehicle.

original: pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, the Great Vehicle is taught.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar khas mi len lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar khas mi len lags so //
translated: Lord, in this way, a bodhisattva is not accepted in the past.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyi ma'i mthar khas mi len lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyi ma'i mthar khas mi len lags so //
translated: A bodhisattva is not accepted in the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dbus su khas mi len lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dbus su khas mi len lags so //
translated: A bodhisattva is not accepted in the present.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gzugs mu ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: gzugs mu ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: because form is boundless,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mu ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mu ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: a bodhisattva should be known as boundless.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mu ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mu ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: Because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are boundless,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mu ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mu ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: the bodhisattva should be known as limitless.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu'ang ma mchis shing /🔽mi dmigs lags so //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu'ang ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu'ang ma mchis shing / mi dmigs lags so // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu'ang ma mchis shing /
translated: a bodhisattva called ‘form’ does not exist and is not found.

original: mi dmigs lags so //
analyzed: mi dmigs lags so //
translated: A bodhisattva called ‘feeling,’ ‘perception,’ ‘volitional factors,’ or ‘consciousness’ does not exist and is not found.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /🔽ma dmigs lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag par rjes su ma mthong / ma dmigs lags na /
translated: Blessed One, in that way I do not see and do not apprehend a bodhisattva great being in any way at all, in every way at all.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @318b pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @318b pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
translated: If that is the case, Blessed One, which bodhisattva great being should I instruct and teach which perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de ni ming tsam du bas lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de ni ming tsam du bas lags so //
translated: ‘Bodhisattva’ is merely a designation.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper bgyi na /
analyzed: dper bgyi na /
translated: for example,

original: bdag bdag ces bgyi ba'ang bdag mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: bdag bdag ces bgyi ba'ang bdag mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
translated: although it is said ‘self, self,’ a self that is established is utterly nonexistent.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi'ang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi'ang /
translated: in the same way, although it is said ‘bodhisattva, bodhisattva,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
translated: a bodhisattva that is established is utterly nonexistent.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar chos rnams rang bzhin ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams rang bzhin ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if phenomena are thus without intrinsic nature,

original: gang mngon par grub pa'i gzugs de gang lags /
analyzed: gang mngon par grub pa'i gzugs de gang lags /
translated: what is that form that is established?

original: gang mngon par grub pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang mngon par grub pa'i rnam par shes pa de gang lags /
analyzed: gang mngon par grub pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang mngon par grub pa'i rnam par shes pa de gang lags /
translated: What is that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that is established?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so; ;gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma lags so //
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so; ;gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma lags so //
translated: That which is not established is not form, and that which is not established is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mngon par ma grub pa las gud na gang byang chub kyi slad du spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa las gud na gang byang chub kyi slad du spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: apart from that which is not established, a bodhisattva great being who would practice for awakening cannot be apprehended.

original: ci mngon par ma grub pa de mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: ci mngon par ma grub pa de mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi lags sam /
translated: So, is that which is not established to be instructed in and taught the perfection of wisdom that is not established?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: when it is taught in that way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum mi 'gong zhing /🔽yid 'gyod par mi 'gyur la /🔽mi skrag mi dngang @319a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum mi 'gong zhing / yid 'gyod par mi 'gyur la / mi skrag mi dngang @319a *//
translated: the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not become cowed, does not tense up,🔽does not feel frightened, does not feel terrified,

original: zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: and does not become terrified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, it should be known that a bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de nas che  dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas che  dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, why

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len pa yin /
translated: do you not assert a bodhisattva at the prior limit?

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar khas mi len pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mthar khas mi len pa yin /
translated: Why do you not assert a bodhisattva at the later limit?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbus su khas mi len pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbus su khas mi len pa yin /
translated: Why do you not assert a bodhisattva in the middle?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why

original: gzugs mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /
analyzed: gzugs mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /
translated: do you know that a bodhisattva is infinite because form is infinite?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /
translated: Do you know that a bodhisattva is infinite because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are infinite?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu'ang med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu'ang med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: “Form, up to consciousness is not so, and is not apprehended as so.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu'ang med cing mi dmigs pa yin /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu'ang med cing mi dmigs pa yin / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not so, and are not apprehended as so.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de ltar bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de ltar bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du /
translated: ‘Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽mi dmigs lags na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / mi dmigs lags na /
translated: in that way I do not see and do not apprehend a bodhisattva great being at all, in any way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @319b po gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smra /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @319b po gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
translated: so which bodhisattva great being should I advise and instruct in which perfection of wisdom?’

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say,🔽‘Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de ni ming tsam du bas lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de ni ming tsam du bas lags so //
translated: The so-called bodhisattva is just a name.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du smra /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du smra /
translated: This is what they say.🔽🔽

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dper bgyi na /
analyzed: dper bgyi na /
translated: for example,

original: bdag bdag ces bgyi'ang bdag mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: bdag bdag ces bgyi'ang bdag mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
translated: although it is said ‘self, self,’ a self that is established is absolutely nonexistent.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi'ang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi'ang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par grub pa ni gtan ma mchis lags so //
translated: in the same way, although it is said ‘bodhisattva, bodhisattva,’ a bodhisattva that is established is absolutely nonexistent.🔽”

original: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ltar chos rnams dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: if phenomena are essentially unreal,

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa'i gzugs de gang lags /
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa'i gzugs de gang lags /
translated: what is the form that is not established?

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang mngon par ma grub pa'i rnam par shes pa de gang lags /
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gang mngon par ma grub pa'i rnam par shes pa de gang lags /
translated: What is the feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that is not established?

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so //
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags so //
translated: What is not established is not form.

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma lags so //
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma lags so //
translated: What is not established is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say,

original: ci mngon par ma grub pa de mngon par ma grub ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi lags sam /
analyzed: ci mngon par ma grub pa de mngon par ma grub ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams par bgyi zhing rjes su bstan par bgyi lags sam /
translated: ‘Should I instruct and teach the perfection of wisdom to that which is not established?’

original: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say,

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par @320a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par @320a *//
translated: ‘Blessed One, that which is not established

original: ma grub pa las rgud na'ang gang byang chub kyi slad du spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs su ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: ma grub pa las rgud na'ang gang byang chub kyi slad du spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dmigs su ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: Even if they were to decline from what has not been accomplished, still, no bodhisattva great being can be apprehended who is practicing for awakening.

original: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhes smra / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why do you say this?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar bstan ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar bstan ba'i tshe /
translated: Blessed One, if, when this is being taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum /
translated: the minds of bodhisattva great beings do not become cowed,

original: mi 'gong zhing yid 'gyod bar mi 'gyur la /🔽mi skrag mi dngang zhing /
analyzed: mi 'gong zhing yid 'gyod bar mi 'gyur la / mi skrag mi dngang zhing /
translated: do not tense up, and do not experience regret,

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: and if they are not frightened, terrified, or filled with dread,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: then, Blessed One, it should be known that those bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes smra / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: zhes smra / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: because there are no sentient beings, I do not assert that bodhisattvas exist from the beginning.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sems can stong pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: sems can stong pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Because sentient beings are empty, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.🔽Venerable Śāriputra,🔽because sentient beings are isolated, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sems can dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: sems can dben pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: because sentient beings are nonapprehensible, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: because sentient beings are insubstantial, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to; ;gzugs stong pa dang / gzugs dben pa dang / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to; ;gzugs stong pa dang / gzugs dben pa dang / gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: because form is nonapprehensible, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit. Because form is empty, because form is isolated, because form is essentially nonexistent, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @320b rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @320b rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Similarly, because feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness do not exist, the bodhisattva is not asserted in the limit of the past.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa dang / rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa dang / rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Because consciousness is empty, because consciousness is isolated, and because consciousness is essentially insubstantial, the bodhisattva is not asserted in the limit of the past.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽because the transcendent perfection of generosity does not exist, the bodhisattva is not asserted in the limit of the past.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Because the transcendent perfection of generosity is empty, because the transcendent perfection of generosity is isolated, and because the transcendent perfection of generosity is essentially insubstantial, the bodhisattva is not asserted in the limit of the past.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Similarly, because the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom do not exist, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is empty, is isolated, and has no intrinsic nature, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang; dbus rnams kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang; dbus rnams kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: it is because in emptiness the past limit, the future limit, and the middle are not apprehended.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan la /
translated: Emptiness is not one thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva is also one thing,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi mi'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi mi'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: and the prior limit, the later limit, and the middle are also other than that.

original: tshe @321a *// dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe @321a *// dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: thus, that which is emptiness and that which is the bodhisattva and the prior limit, the later limit, and the middle are all non-dual and indivisible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: for this reason, the bodhisattva is not accepted in the prior limit, the later limit, and the middle.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: med pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: med pa'ang gzhan /
translated: nonexistence is one thing,

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: emptiness is another,

original: dben pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: dben pa'ang gzhan /
translated: isolation is another,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan /
translated: the absence of intrinsic nature is another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan /
translated: and the bodhisattva is another.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
translated: the perfection of generosity is one thing,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
translated: the perfection of moral discipline is another,🔽the perfection of patience is another,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
translated: the perfection of perseverance is another,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan /
translated: the perfection of concentration is another,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan zhing /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom is another,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: and the past, future, and present are another,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na med pa gang yin pa dang / stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dben pa gang yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na med pa gang yin pa dang / stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dben pa gang yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gang yin pa dang /
translated: but, Venerable Śāriputra, nonexistence is not one thing, emptiness another, isolation another, no intrinsic nature another, and the six perfections another,🔽and the past, future, and present are not another.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: The bodhisattva, the past, the future, and the present are all without duality and cannot be divided into two.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @321b bu; rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @321b bu; rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for this reason the bodhisattva is not accepted in the past, future, or present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: nang stong pa nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar khas mi len to //
translated: because inner emptiness does not exist, the bodhisattva is not accepted in the past.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature not existing, the bodhisattva is not accepted in the past, future, or present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: nang stong pa nyid med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid stong pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dben pa dang / nang stong pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid stong pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dben pa dang / nang stong pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the emptiness of internal phenomena is non-existent, the emptiness of internal phenomena is empty, the emptiness of internal phenomena is void, and the emptiness of internal phenomena is essentially inexistent, and because the past, future, and present are non-apprehensible.🔽because the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is non-existent, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is empty, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is void, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is essentially inexistent, and because the past, future, and present are non-apprehensible.🔽Because the emptiness of internal phenomena is non-existent, empty, void, and essentially inexistent, and because the past, future, and present are non-apprehensible.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid stong pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dben pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽nang stong pa nyid med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid stong pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dben pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽nang stong pa nyid med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan la /
translated: Because the emptiness of external phenomena is non-existent, empty, void, and essentially inexistent, and because the past, future, and present are non-apprehensible.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan zhing /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is one thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan la /
translated: and the bodhisattvas are another;

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: and the past, future, and present are another.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de ltar na nang stong pa nyid med pa dang / stong pa @322a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / de ltar na nang stong pa nyid med pa dang / stong pa @322a *//
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽thus, the nonexistence, emptiness,🔽solitude, and lack of intrinsic nature of internal emptiness,🔽up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and the nonexistence, emptiness, solitude, and lack of intrinsic nature of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: dang; dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: dang; dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: and

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: The bodhisattva, the past, the future, and the middle—all these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: for this reason the bodhisattva is not accepted in the past, future, or present.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: further, the bodhisattva is not accepted in the past, future, or present because the applications of mindfulness do not exist.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams stong pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dben pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams stong pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dben pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang /
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness are empty, and because the applications of mindfulness are isolated, and because the applications of mindfulness are essentially nonexistent,

original: dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: bodhisattvas do not assert them in the past,🔽in the future, or in the present.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams med pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams med pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: Similarly, because the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the path, the powers, the forms of fearlessness, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
translated: and the distinct attributes of a buddha do not exist,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: bodhisattvas do not assert them in the past, in the future, or in the present.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos @322b rnams stong pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dben pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos @322b rnams stong pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dben pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: Because the qualities of the Buddha are empty, the qualities of the Buddha are isolated, and the qualities of the Buddha are essenceless, the bodhisattva does not assert the past, future, and middle with regard to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because the past, future, and middle are not apprehended in the nonexistent, the empty, the isolated, and the essenceless.

original: med pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: med pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
translated: The nonexistent is not one thing,

original: stong pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: stong pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
translated: the empty another,

original: dpen pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: dpen pa'ang gzhan ma yin /
translated: the isolated another,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan ma yin zhing /
translated: and the essenceless another.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The applications of mindfulness are not one thing,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du'ang gzhan ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du'ang gzhan ma yin zhing /
translated: and the qualities of the Buddha another.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the past, future, and present are not different.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de ltar na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang /🔽phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / de ltar na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin thams cad med pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings med pa dang / de bzhin nyid @323a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin thams cad med pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings med pa dang / de bzhin nyid @323a *//
translated: Furthermore, all meditative stabilizations do not exist, all dhāraṇī gateways do not exist, the dharma-constituent does not exist, suchness does not exist,

original: med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' stong pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dben pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' stong pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dben pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: the very limit of reality does not exist, the very limit of reality is empty, the very limit of reality is isolated, and the very limit of reality has no intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, bodhisattvas do not assert a past, a future, or a middle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ting nge 'dzin med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the past, the future, and a middle are not apprehended in the nonexistence of meditative stabilization, up to the nonexistence of the very limit of reality, up to the intrinsic nature of the very limit of reality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: med pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: med pa'ang gzhan /
translated: nonexistence is one thing,

original: stong pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: stong pa'ang gzhan /
translated: emptiness is another,🔽and

original: dben pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: dben pa'ang gzhan /
translated: solitude is one thing,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan /
translated: essencelessness is another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan /
translated: a bodhisattva is another,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du'ang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du'ang gzhan zhing /
translated: and the very limit of reality is another,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: and the past, future, and present are another.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na med pa gang yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar dang; byang chub sems dpa' dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang /🔽dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag ni thams cad kyi thams cad /
analyzed: de ltar na med pa gang yin pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar dang; byang chub sems dpa' dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams gang yin pa de dag ni thams cad kyi thams cad /
translated: thus, what is nonexistent, up to what is essenceless, what is meditative stabilization, up to what is the very limit of reality, what is a bodhisattva, and what is the past, future, and present—

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: all of those are in every way not two and are not divided.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: through this one of many explanations,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: The bodhisattva does not accept the past, the future, or the present.

original: tshe dang @323b ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽gzhan yang nyan thos med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: tshe dang @323b ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / gzhan yang nyan thos med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽the bodhisattva does not accept the past, the future, or the present because the śrāvaka does not exist.

original: nyan thos stong pa dang / nyan thos dben pa dang / nyan thos ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: nyan thos stong pa dang / nyan thos dben pa dang / nyan thos ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: The bodhisattva does not accept the past, the future, or the present because the śrāvaka is empty, because the śrāvaka is isolated, and because the śrāvaka has no intrinsic nature.

original: rang sangs rgyas med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dben pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dben pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang /
translated: and because the knowledge of all aspects is essenceless,🔽a bodhisattva is not accepted in the past,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: in the future, or in the present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang; ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang; ngo bo nyid med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past, the future, and the present are not apprehended in the nonexistent, the empty, the isolated, and the essenceless.

original: med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan zhing /
analyzed: med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'ang gzhan zhing /
translated: The nonexistent, the empty, the isolated, and the essenceless are not one thing,🔽and the past, the future, and the present another.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyang gzhan la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyang gzhan la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: the bodhisattvas, the śrāvakas, and the pratyekabuddhas are not one thing, and the past, future, and present are not another;

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar na med pa dang / stong pa dang / dben pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: thus nonexistence, emptiness, isolation, no sentient beings, no life-force, no individuals, and the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and buddhas are not two, nor are they divided.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam @324a *// grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
analyzed: rnam @324a *// grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus rnams su khas mi len to //
translated: for this reason bodhisattvas do not assert the past, future, and present.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: khyod gang 'di skad du; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
analyzed: khyod gang 'di skad du; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /
translated: you asked, ‘Venerable Subhūti, why is it that bodhisattvas are not asserted in the past, future, and present?’

original: gzugs mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /
analyzed: gzugs mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mu med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mu med par rig par bya /
translated: Because form is boundless, bodhisattvas should be known as boundless.

original: zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are boundless, bodhisattvas should be known as boundless.🔽”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzugs ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: form is the same as space.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are the same as space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:
